bibl.title: Yaichiro Goto v. Henry M. White. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington,
In the Matter of the Application of YAICHIRO GOTO, otherwise known as YAICHIRO MATSUO, For Writ of Habeas Corpus.

IT APPEARING TO THE COURT from the verified petition on file herein, that petitioner is now held in the custody of Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration, and that said petitioner is held illegally, and that although no fair hearing has been accorded him unless a restraining order issue him, he will be deported to the Kingdom of Japan. NOW THEREFORE:

IT IS ORDERED AND DECREED: That Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, in charge of the Immigration station and detention house at Seattle, and such persons acting under or in behalf of said commissioner, having custody of said Yaichero Goto, otherwise known as Yaichero Matsuo, being and appearing before this honorable court, at the Court room in the Federal Building, in the City of Seattle on the 1st day of April, 1921, at 10 o'clock in the forenoon of said day, then and there to show cause if any they may have why a writ of Habeas Corpus should not issue herein, and in the meantime:

The United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, as well as said persons who are acting under and through you in behalf of the United States Government are hereby restrained, and enjoined from deporting or placing, or removing the petitioner, Yaichero Goto, otherwise known as
Yaichero Matsu from this district, and from carrying into effect any warrant or order for a deportation, which may be held by you or either of you.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that a certified copy of this order shall be served upon the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White in charge of the United States Immigration Station at Seattle, Washington, or any such Government official in charge of said Yaichero Goto, otherwise known as Yaichero Matsuo, as a sufficient notice of the above instruction.
DONE IN OPEN COURT this 30th day of March, 1921.
I hereby certify and and return this writ on Henry M. White by receiving J. H. Sargeant asst Comms of Immigration
Filed in the United States District Court
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Yaichiro Goto, otherwise known as Yaichiro Matsuo.
Filed in the United States District Court
Service of papers in this case may be made upon Attorney for at No. Street Room Block
